author: tennisbowling

author: tennisbowling
content: not sure what I was thinking. ignore that

author: m.kalinin
content: A proposer can't know that until EL executes a block, there was a proposal of including the balance into response of this call. But it then was found useless, because the probability of builders to provide proposer with more valuable block (in terms of coinbase diff) is much bigger comparing to local EL. In the current design local EL is used as a fallback in case of mev-boost/builders failure

author: tennisbowling
content: I'm trying to do a multiplexer between multiple non-mev-boost EE's (so only local EEs) then there would be a more or less noticeable difference for the coinbase no?

author: m.kalinin
content: This is the use case that isn't considered in Engine API design. Currently, there is no way to assess the feeRecipient diff that allows to avoid payload execution. What is the value of having this kind of functionality in the multiplexer? Won't different EEs be more or less on the same profitability level given the same set of transactions in the mempool?

author: ryanleeschneider
content: If you use `--kiln` no genesis file is necessary.  You can send the node `eth_chainId` (or for example `geth attach /path/to/geth.ipc` then execute `eth.chainId()`) to determine which chain a node is on.
